column4: my understanding of security in ubuntu is the admin puts in their own password, not a "root" password...it sounds like you're thinkin along the lines of a regular user putting in a separate password to be an admin and this isn't the case in ubuntu....they have to be an admin as jrib stated
But Ubuntu just uses sudo. And that, with sudoers, is configurable. I just don't know how or if it's possible to do it the way I'm thinking of
Oh, maybe I should ask in ##linux?

I can't think of a way to do it out side of creating your own security model with ubuntu or another distro.....at that point it may be hard to get support since you will  be the only one with that model....
